tutorial.title: Introduction to Python
tutorial.description: Python is a versatile, high-level, interpreted language. It's widely used in web development, data science, automation, and more.

subtopics.title: What is Python?
subtopics.explanation: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its clean syntax and readability. It's used in fields like web development, AI, data science, automation, and more.

subtopics.title: History and versions
subtopics.explanation: Python was created by Guido van Rossum in 1991. The two main branches are Python 2 and Python 3, with Python 3 being the current standard.

subtopics.title: Installing Python and IDEs
subtopics.explanation: You can install Python from python.org. Recommended IDEs include IDLE (default), VS Code, and PyCharm.

subtopics.title: Writing and running your first Python script
subtopics.explanation: Create a file with .py extension and write: print('Hello World'). Run it using the command: python filename.py.

subtopics.title: Advantages of Python in real-world development
subtopics.explanation: Python is easy to learn, has a vast collection of libraries, and supports cross-platform development. Itâ€™s widely adopted in academia and industry.

subtopics.title: Who is sowjanaya?
subtopics.explanation: dont knon

tutorial.title: Introduction to C
tutorial.description: C is a powerful, low-level programming language used for system programming and embedded development.

subtopics.title: What is C?
subtopics.explanation: C is a procedural programming language used to develop system applications like operating systems and compilers.

subtopics.title: Structure of a C Program
subtopics.explanation: A basic C program includes headers, a main() function, and statements enclosed in curly braces.

subtopics.title: Compiling and Executing
subtopics.explanation: Use a C compiler like GCC to compile and run programs. Example: gcc file.c -o program

subtopics.title: Header Files
subtopics.explanation: Standard C library header files like stdio.h, stdlib.h, etc., are included using #include directive.

subtopics.title: Difference from Other Languages
subtopics.explanation: C is close to hardware and memory-efficient but lacks features like OOP found in high-level languages like Java or Python.

tutorial.title: Introduction to C++
tutorial.description: C++ is an extension of C that supports object-oriented programming.

subtopics.title: What is C++?
subtopics.explanation: C++ is a statically typed, compiled language that supports both procedural and object-oriented programming paradigms.

subtopics.title: Advantages of C++
subtopics.explanation: C++ provides more structure, OOP features, and standard libraries compared to C.

subtopics.title: First Program in C++
subtopics.explanation: Use iostream library to write: cout << "Hello World"; inside main(). Compile using g++.

subtopics.title: Classes and Objects
subtopics.explanation: C++ introduced the concept of classes and objects for encapsulation and modular design.

subtopics.title: Inheritance and Polymorphism
subtopics.explanation: C++ supports class inheritance, function overloading, and virtual functions for dynamic polymorphism.

tutorial.title: Introduction to AI & ML
tutorial.description: Understand the fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning and how they are applied in real-world systems.

subtopics.title: What is AI?
subtopics.explanation: AI refers to the simulation of human intelligence in machines that are programmed to think and learn.

subtopics.title: What is Machine Learning?
subtopics.explanation: ML is a subset of AI that enables systems to learn from data and improve performance over time without being explicitly programmed.

subtopics.title: Supervised vs Unsupervised Learning
subtopics.explanation: Supervised learning uses labeled data, while unsupervised learning finds patterns in unlabeled data.

subtopics.title: Popular ML Algorithms
subtopics.explanation: Linear Regression, Decision Trees, KNN, SVM, and Neural Networks are commonly used ML algorithms.

subtopics.title: Real-World Applications
subtopics.explanation: AI/ML is used in voice assistants, recommendation systems, fraud detection, image recognition, and more.
